subject: KEEPING ALERT
reflection:
When we give with no thought of receiving, we show what it means to truly serve others. But that means we need to be careful that we don’t allow the world to corrupt us, we need to commit ourselves to Christ’s ethical and moral system, not on the world’s. We are not
to adapt to the world’s value system, which is based on money, power, and pleasure. True faith means nothing if we are contaminated with such values.
prayer: Holy God, help us to serve others selflessly and resist the corrupting influences of worldly values. May our faith be pure and our actions aligned with Christ's teachings, untainted by the pursuit of money, power, or pleasure. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 1730cdd5b7f70ed4
subject   : Subject: KEEPING ALERT (7-2-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>

date      : Wed, 1 Jul 2020 19:11:40 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Pure and lasting religion in the sight of God **our Father means that we
must care for orphans **and widows in their troubles, and refuse to let **the
world corrupt us. *(Jm. 1:27)



*Today’s Reflection:*

When we give with no thought of receiving, we show what it means to truly
serve others. But that means we need to be careful that we don’t allow the
world to corrupt us, we need to commit our-selves* to* Christ’s
ethical and moral
system, not on the world’s. We are not

to adapt to the world’s value system, which is based on money, power, and
pleasure. *True **faith means nothing if we are contaminated **with such
values.*

* Pastor Sather *
verse_text: Pure and lasting religion in the sight of God our Father means that we must care for orphans and widows in their troubles, and refuse to let the world corrupt us.

to adapt to the world’s value system, which is based on money, power, and pleasure. True faith means nothing if we are contaminated with such values.

subject: RECOGNIZING OR LIMITATIONS
reflection: Although God did not remove Paul’s affliction, He promised to demonstrate His power in Paul. The fact that God’s power is displayed in our weakness should give us courage and hope. As we recognize our limitations, we will depend more on God for our effectiveness rather than on our own energy, effort, or talent. Our limitations not only help develop Christian character but also deepen our worship because in admitting them, we affirm God’s strength. Please give us a dose of your wisdom today and every day. Amen.
prayer: Faithful God, help us to embrace our limitations and weaknesses, trusting that Your power will be made perfect in them. May we depend more fully on Your strength and wisdom, deepening our worship and character as we acknowledge Your sufficiency in all things. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 17311bb2c6d14fe8
subject   : Subject: RECOGNIZING OR LIMITATIONS (7-3-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Thu, 2 Jul 2020 17:52:26 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

(Christ) *“My gracious favor is all you need. My power **works best in your
weakness.” *(Paul)* So now I am glad*

*to boast about my weakness so that the power of Christ **may work through
me. *

(2 Cor. 12:9)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Although God did not remove Paul’s affliction, He promised to demonstrate
His power in Paul. The fact that God’s power is displayed in our weakness
should give us courage and hope. As we

recognize our limitations, we will depend more on God for our effectiveness
rather than on our own energy, effort, or talent.

Our limitations not only help develop Christian character but also deepen
our worship because in admitting them, we affirm God’s strength. *Please
give us a dose of your wisdom today **and every day. Amen.*

* Pastor Sather*
verse_text: (Christ) “My gracious favor is all you need. My power works best in your weakness.” (Paul) So now I am glad to boast about my weakness so that the power of Christ may work through me.
original_verse_text: (Christ) “My gracious favor is all you need. My power works best in your weakness.” (Paul) So now I am glad to boast about my weakness so that the power of Christ may work through me.
original_reflection_text: Although God did not remove Paul’s affliction, He promised to demonstrate His power in Paul. The fact that God’s power is displayed in our weakness should give us courage and hope. As we recognize our limitations, we will depend more on God for our effectiveness rather than on our own energy, effort, or talent. Our limitations not only help develop Christian character but also deepen our worship because in admitting them, we affirm God’s strength. Please give us a dose of your wisdom today and every day. Amen.

subject: INTACT LIBERTY
reflection:
The Declaration of Independence was a political document with a somewhat religious orientation. It declared that all
people were “endowed by their Creator with certain unalienable rights,” including life, liberty, and the pursuit of happiness. Liberty and freedom are still in our vocabulary. Citizens have the duty and privilege to uphold the principles mentioned in the Declaration of Indepen-dence. Civic freedom needs to be preserved. This document was not conceived in a vacuum.
It was profoundly influ enced by the tenets of the Christian faith. We must not bargain our Christian faith away but stand firm on it. Let us give thanks to God for the freedom we enjoy as citizens.
prayer: Almighty God, we thank You for the freedoms we enjoy and the principles of liberty enshrined in our nation's founding. Help us to stand firm in our faith and to uphold the values of justice and equality for all Your children. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 17316aaf3e5949bf
subject   : Subject: INTACT LIBERTY (7-4-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Fri, 3 Jul 2020 16:52:49 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*“It’s for freedom that Christ has set us free*. *Stand firm, then, **and
do not let yourselves be burdened again by the *

*yoke of **slavery” *(Gal. 5:1)



*Today’s Reflection:*

The Declaration of Independence was a political document with a somewhat
religious orientation. It declared that all

people were “endowed by their Creator with certain unalienable rights,”
including life, liberty, and the pursuit of happiness.

Liberty and freedom are still in our vocabulary. Citizens have the duty and
privilege to uphold the principles men-tioned in the Declaration of
Indepen-dence. Civic freedom needs to be pre-served. This document was not
conceived in a vacuum. It was profoundly influ-

enced by the tenets of the Christian faith. *We must not bargain our
Christian faith **away but stand firm on it. Let us give thanks to God
for **the
freedom we enjoy as citizens.*

* Pastor Sather.*
verse_text: “It’s for freedom that Christ has set us free. Stand firm, then, and do not let yourselves be burdened again by the  yoke of slavery.
original_verse_text: “It’s for freedom that Christ has set us free. Stand firm, then, and do not let yourselves be burdened again by the  yoke of slavery.
original_reflection_text:
The Declaration of Independence was a political document with a somewhat religious orientation. It declared that all
people were “endowed by their Creator with certain unalienable rights,” including life, liberty, and the pursuit of happiness. Liberty and freedom are still in our vocabulary. Citizens have the duty and privilege to uphold the principles mentioned in the Declaration of Indepen-dence. Civic freedom needs to be preserved. This document was not conceived in a vacuum.
It was profoundly influ enced by the tenets of the Christian faith. We must not bargain our Christian faith away but stand firm on it. Let us give thanks to God for the freedom we enjoy as citizens.

subject: IMPORTANCE OF FAITH
reflection: A person is never too old to serve God, never too old to pray. Though age may stop us from certain physical activities, it need not end our desire to tell others (especially children) about all we have seen God do in our many years of life. Hope in Him helps us too keep going, to serve Him.
prayer: Eternal God, we thank You for the enduring strength and wisdom You grant to those who have walked with You for many years, and we ask that You inspire us to share our experiences of Your faithfulness with the next generation. Help us to serve You with hope and joy in every season of life. (AI)

*Today’s Verse:*

*Now that I am old and gray, do not abandon **me, O God. *(Ps. 71:18)



*Today’s Reflection:*

A person is never too old to serve God, never too old to pray. Though age
may stop us from certain physical activities, it need not end our desire to
tell others (especially children) about all we have seen God do in our many
years of life.

*Hope in Him helps us too keep going, *

*to **serve Him.*

* Pastor Sather*
verse_text: Now that I am old and gray, do not abandon me, O God.

Though age may stop us from certain physical activities, it need not end our desire to tell others (especially children) about all we have seen God do in our many years of life. Hope in Him helps us too keep going, to serve Him.

subject: THE DECISION IS OURS
reflection: Jesus knocks at the door of our heart because He wants to save us and have fellowship with us. He is patient and persistent trying to get through to us-not breaking and entering, but knocking. He allows us to decide whether or not to open our life to him. Do not intentionally keep His life-changing presence and power on the other side of the door.
prayer: Gracious God, help us to recognize and respond to Jesus knocking at the door of our hearts, opening ourselves to His transformative presence and power. May we not hesitate to welcome Him in, embracing the fellowship and salvation He offers. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 173213d108a5a4da
subject   : Subject: THE DECISION IS OURS (7-6-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sun, 5 Jul 2020 18:08:37 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Look! Here I stand and knock. If you hear me calling **and open the door,
I will come in, and I will share a **meal as friends. *(Rev. 3:20)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Jesus knocks at the door of our heart because He wantsto save

us and have fellowship with us. He is patient and persistent

trying to get through to us—not breaking and entering, but

knocking. He allows us to decide whether or not to open our

life to him. *Do not intention**ally keep His life-changing presence and
power on **the other side of the **door.*

* Pastor Sather *
verse_text:
Look!
Here I stand and knock. If you hear me calling and open the door, I will come in, and I will share a meal as friends.

Look!
Here I stand and knock. If you hear me calling and open the door, I will come in, and I will share a meal as friends.

He is patient and persistent trying to get through to us-not breaking and entering, but knocking. He allows us to decide whether or not to open our life to him. Do not intentionally keep His life-changing presence and power on the other side of the door.

subject: CLING TO YOUR CHILDLIKE FAITH
reflection:
Children are able to trust and praise God without doubt
or reservations. As we get older, many of us find this
more and more difficult to do. Ask God to give you
childlike faith, AND to remove all barriers so that you may have a closer walk with Him.
prayer: Holy God, grant us the pure and simple faith of a child, free from doubt and hesitation, that we may trust and praise You wholeheartedly. Remove any barriers that hinder our relationship with You, drawing us ever closer to Your loving presence. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 1732640d0083f510
subject   : Subject: CLING TO YOUR CHILDLIKE FAITH (7-7-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Mon, 6 Jul 2020 17:30:49 -0500

*Today’s Verse:*

*You have taught children and nursing infants to give you*

* praise. They silence your enemies who were seeking*

* revenge. *(Ps. 8:2)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Children are able to trust and praise God without doubt

or reservations. As we get older, many of us find this

more and more difficult to do. Ask God to give you

childlike faith, *AND to remove all barriers so that *

*you may have a closer walk with Him*.

*Pastor Sather*

subject: TREASURE HIS PRESENCE
reflection:
How can Jesus be “with us”? Jesus was with the
disciples physically until He ascended into heaven
and then spiritually through the Holy Spirit (Acts 1;4).
The Holy Spirit would be Jesus presence that would
never leave them (John 14:26). Jesus continues to be with us through the Holy Spirit.
prayer: Lord Jesus, we thank You for Your enduring presence through the Holy Spirit, who guides and comforts us in our daily lives. Help us to be ever mindful of Your constant companionship and to draw strength from Your unfailing love. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 1732bbc4f6f92b98
subject   : Subject: TREASURE HIS PRESENCE (7-8-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>

date      : Tue, 7 Jul 2020 19:03:48 -0500

*Today’s Verse:*

*“Be sure of this: I am with you always, even to*

*the end of the age.” *(Mt. 28:20b)



*Today’s Reflection:*

How can Jesus be “with us”? Jesus was with the

disciples physically until He ascended into heaven

and then spiritually through the Holy Spirit (Acts 1;4).

The Holy Spirit would be Jesus presence that would

never leave them (Jn. 14:26). *Jesus continues to be*

*with us through the Holy Spirit. *

* Pastor Sather*
verse_text: Be sure of this: I am with you always, even to the end of the age.

subject: SEEKING PROPER THOUGHTS
reflection:
Setting our sights on heaven means striving
to put heavenly priorities into daily practice.
Letting heaven fill our thoughts means con entreating on the eternal instead of the tem poral.
We need to let the peace of Christ rule in our hearts.
prayer: Eternal God, help us to focus our thoughts and actions on heavenly priorities, allowing the peace of Christ to reign in our hearts as we strive to live with an eternal perspective. May we be ever mindful of Your kingdom and its values in our daily lives. (AI)

*Todays Verse: *

*Set your affection on things above, not of things*

* of the earth *(Col. 3:2)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Setting our sights on heaven means striving

to put heavenly priorities into daily practice.

Letting heaven fill our thoughts means con-

centrating on the eternal instead of the tem-

poral. *We need to let the peace of* *Christ *

*rule in our hearts.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: LET GO AND LET GOD
reflection:
Anger, rage, and envy are very destructive
emotions.
They reveal a lack of faith that
God loves us and is in control. We should
not worry, instead we should trust in God,
giving ourselves to Him for His use and
safekeeping.
When you dwell on your
problems, you will become anxious and
angry.
But if you concentrate on God and
His goodness, you will find peace. Where do you focus your attention?
prayer: Gracious God, help us to release our anger, rage, and envy, and instead focus our hearts and minds on Your goodness and love. Grant us the strength to trust in Your control and find peace in surrendering ourselves to Your care and purpose. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 17335c2bacddfc57
subject   : Subject: LET GO AND LET GOD (7-10-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Thu, 9 Jul 2020 17:47:01 -0500
===================================================================

===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Refrain from anger and turn from wrath; do *

*not fret—it only leads to evil.* Ps. 37:8)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Anger, rage, and envy are very destructive

emotions. They reveal a lack of faith that

God loves us and is in control. We should

not worry, instead we should trust in God,

giving ourselves to Him for His use and

safekeeping. When you dwell on your

problems, you will become anxious and

angry. But if you concentrate on God and

His goodness, you will find peace. *Where*

*do you focus your attention?*

* Pastor Sather *
verse_text: Refrain from anger and turn from wrath; do  not fret-it only leads to evil.

safekeeping.
When you dwell on your
problems, you will become anxious and
angry.
But if you concentrate on God and
His goodness, you will find peace. Where do you focus your attention?

subject: DOING OUR SAVIOR'S WILL
reflection:
Jesus is always asking us to extend ourselves to
those on the fringes. . . to children, to elderly, to
those who are unruly and unwanted. He always
invites “the least of these” to experience His
love and grace and wants us to do the same.
prayer: Loving God, help us to follow Jesus' example by extending ourselves to those on the fringes of society, showing Your love and grace to all, especially the least and the forgotten. May we embrace children, the elderly, and those who are unwanted, reflecting Your boundless compassion in our actions. (AI)

*Jesus said, “Let the little children come to Me,*

*and do not hinder them, for the kingdom of*

*heaven belongs to such as these. *(Mt. 19:14)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Jesus is always asking us to extend ourselves to

those on the fringes*. .* . to children, to elderly, to

those who are unruly and unwanted. He always

invites “the least of these” to experience His

love and grace and wants us to do the same.

subject: HEALING THROUGH FORGIVENESS
reflection:
Jesus wants us to experience His peace and hope; even
when faced with tragedy and cruelty. When we ask Jesus
to help us forgive, He opens the door to healing. Ask Jesus to help you forgive those who have wronged you and let Him usher His peace and hope into your life.
prayer: Merciful God, help us to forgive those who have wronged us, just as Jesus taught, so that we may experience Your healing peace and hope even in the face of tragedy and cruelty. Open our hearts to Your transformative power, allowing us to embrace forgiveness and find renewed strength in Your love. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 1733ffeccbad3d3f
subject   : Subject: HEALING THROUGH FORGIVENESS (2-12-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sat, 11 Jul 2020 17:28:50 -0500
===================================================================

===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*If you forgive other people when they sin against you,*

* your heavenly Father will also forgive you. But if you *

*don’t** forgive others their sins, your Father will not*

*forgive you. *(Mt. 6;14-15)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Jesus wants us to experience His peace and hope; even

when faced with tragedy and cruelty. When we ask Jesus

to help us forgive, He opens the door to healing. *Ask *

*Jesus to help you forgive those who have wronged *

*you and let Him usher His peace and hope into your *

*life.*

* Pastor Sather*
verse_text: If you forgive other people when they sin against you, your heavenly Father will also forgive you. But if you  don’t  forgive others their sins, your Father will not forgive you.

Jesus wants us to experience His peace and hope; even
when faced with tragedy and cruelty. When we ask Jesus
to help us forgive, He opens the door to healing. Ask Jesus to help you forgive those who have wronged you and let Him usher His peace and hope into your life.

subject: TAKE NOTE OF THE TIME
reflection:
Does Paul’s reference to the “last days” sound like
The times we are living in? Paul reveals his sense
of our urgency. The last day began after Jesus’
resurrection when the Holy Spirit came upon the believers at Pentecost. The “Last days” will continue until Christ’s second coming. This means that we are living in the last days. So we should make the most of the time that God has given us. (Ephesians 5:16)
prayer: Holy God, help us to recognize the urgency of these last days and to use our time wisely in service to You and others. May we be filled with Your Spirit and live with purpose, eagerly awaiting Christ's return. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 173459b181e99b6c
subject   : Subject: TAKE NOTE OF THE TIME (7-13-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sun, 12 Jul 2020 19:37:39 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Understand this, that in the last days there will *

*come times of difficulty. For people will be lovers*

*of self, lovers of money, proud, arrogant, abusive, *

*disobedient to their parents, ungrateful, unholy.*

(2 Tim. 3:1-2)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Does Paul’s reference to the “last days” sound like

The times we are living in? Paul reveals his sense

of our urgency. *The last day* began after Jesus’

resurrection when the Holy Spirit came upon

the believers at Pentecost. The “Last days” will

continue until Christ’s second coming. This

means that we are living in the last days. *So *

*we should make **the most of the time that *

*God has given us. **(Eph. 5:16) *

* Pastor Sather*
verse_text: Understand this, that in the last days there will  come times of difficulty. For people will be lovers of self, lovers of money, proud, arrogant, abusive,  disobedient to their parents, ungrateful, unholy.

resurrection when the Holy Spirit came upon the believers at Pentecost. The “Last days” will continue until Christ’s second coming. This means that we are living in the last days. So we should make the most of the time that God has given us. (Ephesians 5:16)

subject: HOW DO YOU MEASURE UP
reflection:
It is important to listen to what God’s Word says,
but it is much more important to obey it and do
what it says. We can measure the effectiveness
of our bible study time by the effect it has on
our behavior and attitudes. Do you put into action what you have studied?
prayer: Gracious God, help us to not only hear Your Word but to faithfully apply it in our daily lives, transforming our behavior and attitudes. May our study of Scripture bear fruit in obedience and action, reflecting Your will in all we do. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 1734a4baf291a80d
subject   : Subject: HOW DO YOU MEASURE UP (7-14-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Mon, 13 Jul 2020 17:29:01 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Remember, God’s Word is a message to obey, not*

*just to listen to. If you don’t obey, you are fooling*

*yourself. *(Jm. 2:22)



*Today’s Reflection:*

It is important to listen to what God’s Word says,

but it is much more important to obey it and do

what it says. We can measure the effectiveness

of our bible study time by the effect it has on

our behavior and attitudes. *Do you put into*

*action what you have studied? *

* Pastor Sather*
verse_text: Remember, God’s Word is a message to obey, not just to listen to. If you don’t obey, you are fooling yourself.

what it says. We can measure the effectiveness
of our bible study time by the effect it has on
our behavior and attitudes. Do you put into action what you have studied?

subject: BEING A FAITHFUL WITNESS
reflection: Losing a friend, (this may be a family member) is a wakeup call, a chance to assess where we’ve been and where we’re headed. Sometimes it’s a source of joy as we discover the wisdom in another’s life. Learning how they used the gifts the Lord gave them-their time, their money, and their hearts changes us. We should want to live as Jesus did, sharing all, sparing nothing. (question) How can you influence others with your love?
prayer: Loving God, help us to honor the memory of those we've lost by living more fully in Your example, sharing our gifts generously and loving others without reserve. May we be inspired to influence the world around us with Your love, using our time, resources, and hearts to make a lasting impact for Your kingdom. (AI)
original_content:

subject   : Subject: BEING A FAITHFUL WITNESS (7-15-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Tue, 14 Jul 2020 18:06:55 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
Today’s Verse:
His Master replied, “Well done, good and
faithful servant.” (Mt. 25:23) read vss. 14-30

Today’s Reflection:
Losing a friend, (this may be a family member)
is a wakeup call, a chance to assess where we’ve
been and where we’re headed. Sometimes it’s a
source of joy as we discover the wisdom in another’s
life. Learning how they used the gifts the Lord gave
them—their time, their money, and their hearts—
changes us. We should want to live as Jesus did,
sharing all, sparing nothing. (question)
How can you influence others with your love?
Pastor Sather
verse_text: His Master replied, "Well done, good and faithful servant."
original_verse_text: His Master replied, "Well done, good and faithful servant."

Sometimes it’s a source of joy as we discover the wisdom in another’s life. Learning how they used the gifts the Lord gave them-their time, their money, and their hearts changes us. We should want to live as Jesus did, sharing all, sparing nothing. (question) How can you influence others with your love?

subject: A TRUE PURPOSE
reflection:
Jesus didn’t come to earth, suffer, and die so
that we can merely exist; He came for us to
live more abundantly. The best way to live
well is to honor and obey Jesus’ Word. Then
life will overflow with things that satisfy the
soul. And if that is the case, we will also
laugh often and love much. Ask Jesus to show you any habits, attitudes, or behaviors that hold you back from living the full life He wants you to enjoy.
prayer: Lord Jesus, help us recognize and release any habits, attitudes, or behaviors that hinder us from experiencing the abundant life You desire for us. Guide us to honor and obey Your Word, that our souls may overflow with joy, laughter, and love. (AI)
original_content:

*Today’s Verse:*

[Jesus said] “My purpose is to give life in

all its fullness.” (Jn. 10:10)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Jesus didn’t come to earth, suffer, and die so

that we can merely exist; He came for us to

live more abundantly. The best way to live

well is to honor and obey Jesus’ Word. Then

life will overflow with things that satisfy the

soul. And if that is the case, we will also

laugh often and love much. *Ask Jesus to *

*show you any habits, attitudes, or behaviors*

*that hold you back from living the full life*

*He wants you to enjoy.*

*Pastor Sather*

well is to honor and obey Jesus’ Word. Then
life will overflow with things that satisfy the
soul. And if that is the case, we will also
laugh often and love much. Ask Jesus to show you any habits, attitudes, or behaviors that hold you back from living the full life He wants you to enjoy.

subject: THE WAY THINGS USED TO BE
reflection:
There are some days when I just want things
to be the way they were before the Covid 19,
before the restrictions and constraints, before
the long list of don’ts and can’ts. It would be
nice to have a sit down dinner in a restaurant
with friends without a mask. But when I pray
about these feelings, God’s Word reminds me
that God’s plans for our lives is to keep us
moving forward never backward.
(let us pray) Lord, help us to accept that things are going according to Your plan, and that You will give us the strength to go forward.
prayer: Faithful God, grant us the wisdom to trust in Your divine plan and the courage to embrace the changes before us, even as we long for familiar comforts. Help us move forward with hope and resilience, knowing that You are always guiding our steps. (AI)
original_content:

*not on your own understanding; in all your*

*ways submit to Him, and He will make your*

*paths straight. *(Pro. 3:5-6)



*Today’s Reflection:*

There are some days when I just want things

to be the way they were before the Covid 19,

before the restrictions and constraints, before

the long list of don’ts and can’ts. It would be

nice to have a sit down dinner in a restaurant

with friends without a mask. But when I pray

that God’s plans for our lives is to keep us

moving forward never backward.

(let us pray) *Lord, help us to accept that*

*things are going according to Your plan,*

*and that You will give us the strength to*

*go forward.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: A DIFFERENT HEART
reflection:
)
This is Christ’s law of forgiveness as taught in
the Gospels (Matthew 6-18-Mark 11). We also see
it in the Lord’s Prayer-“Forgive us our sins as
we have forgiven those who have sinned against
us.” Refusing to forgive someone is like getting
trapped in a maze of bitterness and resentment
that stunts our spiritual growth and infects all
areas of our life. Even simply neglecting a family
relationship can seal our joy and peace. If we sense of a prompting to take the first step toward reconciliation, it’s a gift from God.
prayer: Merciful God, help us to embrace Your law of forgiveness, releasing us from the maze of bitterness and resentment that hinders our spiritual growth and robs us of joy and peace. Grant us the courage to take the first step toward reconciliation when You prompt us, recognizing it as Your precious gift. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 1735ed03ddbd0cfe
subject   : Subject: A DIFFERENT HEART (7-18-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>

date      : Fri, 17 Jul 2020 17:06:12 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Subject: A DIFFERENT HEART *(7-18-20)



*Today’s Verse:*

*Be kind to one another, tenderhearted, forgiving*

*one another, as God in Christ forgave you. *

(Eph. 4:32)



*(Today’s Reflection)*

This is Christ’s law of forgiveness as taught in

the Gospels (Mt. 6—18—Mk. 11). We also see

it in the Lord’s Prayer—“Forgive us our sins as

we have forgiven those who have sinned against

us.” Refusing to forgive someone is like getting

trapped in a maze of bitterness and resentment

that stunts our spiritual growth and infects all

areas of our life. Even simply neglecting a family

relationship can seal our joy and peace. *If we*

*sense of a prompting to take the first step*

*toward reconciliation, it’s a gift from God.*

* Pastor Sather*
verse_text: Be kind to one another, tenderhearted, forgiving one another, as God in Christ forgave you.
original_verse_text: Be kind to one another, tenderhearted, forgiving one another, as God in Christ forgave you.
original_reflection_text:
)
This is Christ’s law of forgiveness as taught in
the Gospels (Matthew 6-18-Mark 11). We also see
it in the Lord’s Prayer-“Forgive us our sins as
we have forgiven those who have sinned against
us.” Refusing to forgive someone is like getting
trapped in a maze of bitterness and resentment
that stunts our spiritual growth and infects all
areas of our life. Even simply neglecting a family
relationship can seal our joy and peace. If we sense of a prompting to take the first step toward reconciliation, it’s a gift from God.

subject: TIME TO LISTEN
reflection:
Prayer is a two-way conversation, not a mon ologue.
Jesus wants to speak to us and calm
our fears, offer guidance, and assure us of His
loving presence. We can miss His voice if we’re
solely focused on our own agenda. But Jesus
knows us intimately; He also knows what our
day holds. So when it comes to prayer, we should
be glad to let Him dominate the conversation.
prayer: Gracious God, help us to quiet our hearts and minds so that we may hear Your voice more clearly in our prayers. May we be open to Your guidance and comforting presence, trusting that You know our needs even before we speak them. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 17363e6ff85e3cbe
subject   : Subject: TIME TO LISTEN (7-19-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sat, 18 Jul 2020 16:49:10 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*While Peter was talking, a bright cloud covered *

*them. A voice come from the cloud and said, *

*“This is My Son, whom I love, and I am very*

*pleased with Him. Listen to Him!” *(Mt. 17:5)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Prayer is a two-way conversation, not a mon-

ologue. Jesus wants to speak to us and calm

our fears, offer guidance, and assure us of His

loving presence. We can miss His voice if we’re

solely focused on our own agenda. But Jesus

knows us intimately; He also knows what our

day holds. *So* when it comes to prayer, we should

be glad to let Him dominate the conversation.

*Pastor Sather*
verse_text: While Peter was talking, a bright cloud covered  them. A voice come from the cloud and said, "This is My Son, whom I love, and I am very pleased with Him. Listen to Him!"

Prayer is a two-way conversation, not a mon ologue.
Jesus wants to speak to us and calm
our fears, offer guidance, and assure us of His
loving presence. We can miss His voice if we’re
solely focused on our own agenda. But Jesus
knows us intimately; He also knows what our
day holds. So when it comes to prayer, we should
be glad to let Him dominate the conversation.

subject: PRAY REGULARLY
reflection:
The Gospel writers note that before every impor tant event in Jesus life, He took time to go off by
Himself and pray. This time Jesus was preparing
to choose His inner circle, the 12 apostles. Make sure that all your important decisions are grounded in prayer.
prayer: Lord of Life, guide us to follow Jesus' example of seeking Your wisdom through prayer before making significant decisions, and help us cultivate a deeper connection with You in our daily lives. May we always turn to You for guidance and strength as we navigate life's choices and challenges. (AI)

*Today’s Verse:*

*One Day soon afterward, Jesus went up on a*

*mountain to pray, and He prayed to God all*

*night. *(Lk. 6:12)



*Today’s Reflection:*

The Gospel writers note that before every impor-

tant event in Jesus life, He took time to go off by

Himself and pray. This time Jesus was preparing

to choose His inner circle, the 12 apostles. *Make *

*sure that* *all your important decisions are grounded*

*in prayer.*

* Pastor Sather*
verse_text: One Day soon afterward, Jesus went up on a mountain to pray, and He prayed to God all night.

The Gospel writers note that before every impor tant event in Jesus life, He took time to go off by
Himself and pray. This time Jesus was preparing
to choose His inner circle, the 12 apostles. Make sure that all your important decisions are grounded in prayer.

subject: ACCEPTING GOD'S GRACE
reflection:
Paul wrote of working harder than the other
apostles. This was not an arrogant boast,
because he knew that his power came from
God and that it didn’t really matter who
worked hardest. Because of his prominent
position as a Pharisee, Paul’s conversion
made him the object of even greater perse caution than the other apostles; thus, he had
to work harder to preach the same message.
Lord help me to embrace the grace You offer.
prayer: Faithful God, help us to embrace Your grace fully and work diligently in service to You, remembering always that our strength comes from You alone. May we, like Paul, persevere through challenges and persecution, trusting in Your power to accomplish Your purposes through us. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 1736e765b5485562
subject   : Subject: ACCEPTING GOD'S GRACE (7-21-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Mon, 20 Jul 2020 18:01:57 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*But by the grace of God, I am what I am. *
(I Cor. 15:10) NIV



*Today’s Reflection:*

Paul wrote of working harder than the other

apostles. This was not an arrogant boast,

because he knew that his power came from

God and that it didn’t really matter who

worked hardest. Because of his prominent

position as a Pharisee, Paul’s conversion

made him the object of even greater perse-

cution than the other apostles; thus, he had

to work harder to preach the same message.

*Lord help me to embrace the grace You*

*offer.*

* Pastor Sather*
verse_text: But by the grace of God, I am what I am.
original_verse_text: But by the grace of God, I am what I am.
original_reflection_text:
Paul wrote of working harder than the other
apostles. This was not an arrogant boast,
because he knew that his power came from
God and that it didn’t really matter who
worked hardest. Because of his prominent
position as a Pharisee, Paul’s conversion
made him the object of even greater perse caution than the other apostles; thus, he had
to work harder to preach the same message.
Lord help me to embrace the grace You offer.

subject: A SECRET FROM LONG AGO
reflection:
The news that Jesus is not only faithful to save us but
faithful to sustain and strengthen us-this forms a base of
operation for His followers. It’s a truth to which we can
return when our strength is failing. Focusing our thoughts
on the gospel of Jesus Christ makes us stronger than we were
the day before. Remembering what He’s done and is doing
increases our strength for all that lies between here and
heaven.
prayer:
Faithful Jesus, thank You that You not only saved me but
daily sustain and strengthen me. When my strength fails,
turn my mind to the gospel—what You have done and what You
are doing—so my heart is renewed for the road ahead. Anchor
me in Your grace today, and make me stronger for all that
lies between here and heaven. Amen. (AI)
original_content:

*Today’s Verse:*

*Now to Him who is able to strengthen you *

*according **to my gospel and the preaching *

*of Jesus Christ **according to the revelation *

*of the mystery that was **kept secret for long *

*ages. *(Ro. 16:25)



*Today’s Revelation:*

The news that Jesus is not only faithful to

save us but faithful to sustain and strengthen

us—this forms a base of operation for His

followers. It’s a truth to which we can return

when our strength is failing. Focusing our

thoughts on the gospel of Jesus Christ makes

us stronger than we were the day before.

*Remembering what He’s done and is doing *

*increases **our strength for all that lies between *

*here and heaven.*

*Pastor Sather*

gospel and the preaching of Jesus Christ according to the
revelation of the mystery that was kept secret for long
ages.

on the gospel of Jesus Christ makes us stronger than we were

increases our strength for all that lies between here and

subject: FAITH IS THE SECRET
reflection:
Our confidence in Jesus’ ability to guide us to His desired destination should increase as our faith increases over time and through lives experiences. With true faith we should not fear taking the wrong path.
He is too loving and faithful to allow us to take the wrong path.
prayer: Loving God, increase our faith in Jesus' guidance and help us trust in Your unfailing love as we journey through life. May we walk boldly without fear, knowing that You will never lead us astray. (AI)
original_content:

from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Wed, 22 Jul 2020 17:22:20 -0500

===================================================================
*Today’s Verses:*

*Show me the right path, O Lord; point out the *

*right **road for me to follow. Lead me by Your *

*truth and **teach me. For you are the God who *

*saves me. All **day long I put my hope in You. *

(Ps. 25:4-5)



*Today's Reflection:*

Our confidence in Jesus’ ability to guide us

to His desired destination should increase as

our faith increases over time and through

lives experiences. With true faith we should

not fear taking the wrong path. *He is too *

*loving and faithful to allow us to **take *

*the wrong path.*

* Pastor Sather*
verse_text: Show me the right path, O Lord; point out the  right road for me to follow. Lead me by Your  truth and teach me. For you are the God who  saves me. All day long I put my hope in You.

He is too loving and faithful to allow us to take the wrong path.

subject: FLYING TOGETHER
reflection: We have significant privileges associated with our new life in Christ: (1) We have personal access to God through Christ and can draw near to Him without an elaborate system (10:22) (2) we grow in faith, overcome doubts and questions, and deepen our relationship with God (10:23); (3) we may enjoy encourage ment from one another (10:24) (4) we may worship together (10:25).
prayer: Gracious God, thank You for the incredible privileges we have in Christ, including direct access to You, growth in faith, mutual encouragement, and corporate worship. Help us to fully embrace and live out these blessings as we draw near to You and support one another in our spiritual journey. (AI)
original_content:

*Today’s Verses:*

*Let us go right into the presence of God, *

*with true** hearts fully trusting Him, for *

*our evil consciences **have been sprinkled *

*with Christ’s blood to make** us clean, *

*and our bodies have been washed with*

*pure water.—without wavering, let us *

*hold tightly **to the hope we say we have, *

*for God can be trusted** to keep His *

*promise. Think of ways to encourage*

*one another to out bursts of love and *

*good deeds. *(Heb. 10:22-25)



*Today’s Reflection:*

We have significant privileges associated

with our new life in Christ: (1) We have

personal access to God through Christ

and can draw near to Him without an

elaborate system (10:22) (2) we grow

in faith, overcome doubts and questions,

and deepen our relationship with God

(10:23); (3) we may enjoy encourage-

ment from one another (10:24) *(4) we*

*may worship* *together (10:25).*

*Pastor Sather*

Think of ways to encourage one another to out bursts of love and  good deeds.

subject: DO YOUR BEST TO KEEP THE PEACE
reflection: Somehow people think that peace should come to them with no effort. But David explained that we are to work hard at peace. Paul echoes this thought in Romans 12:18. A person who wants peace cannot be argument tative and contentious. Remember peaceful relationships come from our efforts at peace making. Lets work hard at living in peace with others each day.
prayer: Holy God, help us to diligently pursue peace in our relationships, setting aside contentiousness and striving to be peacemakers in our daily interactions. Grant us the wisdom and patience to work hard at fostering harmony with others, just as You have called us to do. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 17382d7d7f554c1a
subject   : Subject: DO YOUR BEST TO KEEP THE PEACE (7-25-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>

date      : Fri, 24 Jul 2020 17:00:50 -0500

===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Turn away from evil and do good. *

*Work hard **at living in peace with *

*others. *(Ps. 34: 14)


*Today’s Reflection:*

Somehow people think that peace should

come to them with no effort. But David

explained that we are to work hard at peace.

Paul echoes this thought in Ro. 12:18. A

person who wants peace cannot be argumen-

tative and contentious. Remember peaceful

relationships come from our efforts at peace-

making. *Lets work hard **at living in peace *

*with others each day.*

*Pastor Sather*
verse_text: Turn away from evil and do good.  Work hard at living in peace with  others.

subject: PLEASING GOD IN ALL THINGS
reflection:
Our joy, prayers, and thankfulness should not
fluctuate with our circumstances or feelings.
Obeying these three commands-be joyful keep praying-be thankful-often goes against
our natural inclinations. When we make a
conscious decision to do what God says, how ever, we will begin to see it easier to be joyful
and thankful. Remember Paul did not say we are to be thankful for all things BUT in all things.
prayer: Faithful God, help us to cultivate joy, persevere in prayer, and maintain gratitude regardless of our circumstances, trusting in Your unchanging goodness even when it challenges our natural inclinations. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 1738829ba94be66c
subject   : Subject: PLEASING GOD IN ALL THINGS (7-26-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sat, 25 Jul 2020 17:48:23 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Rejoice always, pray continually, give thanks*

*in all circumstances; for this is God’s will*

*for you in Christ Jesus. *(I Thess. 5:16-18)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Our joy, prayers, and thankfulness should not

fluctuate with our circumstances or feelings.

Obeying these three commands—be joyful—

keep praying—be thankful—often goes against

our natural inclinations. When we make a

conscious decision to do what God says, how-

ever, we will begin to see it easier to be joyful

and thankful. *Remember Paul did not say*

*we are to be thankful for all things BUT in*

*all things**.*

* Pastor Sather*
verse_text: Rejoice always, pray continually, give thanks in all circumstances; for this is God’s will for you in Christ Jesus.
original_verse_text: Rejoice always, pray continually, give thanks in all circumstances; for this is God’s will for you in Christ Jesus.
original_reflection_text:
Our joy, prayers, and thankfulness should not
fluctuate with our circumstances or feelings.
Obeying these three commands-be joyful keep praying-be thankful-often goes against
our natural inclinations. When we make a
conscious decision to do what God says, how ever, we will begin to see it easier to be joyful
and thankful. Remember Paul did not say we are to be thankful for all things BUT in all things.

subject: ASKING FOR HELP
reflection:
Jesus tells us to persist in pursuing God.
people often give up after a few half hearted efforts and conclude that God
cannot be found. But knowing God takes
faith, focus, and follow through, and
Jesus assures that we will be rewarded.
Don’t give up in your efforts to seek God.
Continue to ask Him for more knowledge, patience, wisdom, and understanding. He will give them to you.
prayer: Lord of Life, grant us the perseverance to seek You wholeheartedly, and the faith to trust in Your promise that we will find You when we search with all our hearts. Strengthen our resolve to continually ask for Your wisdom and understanding, knowing that You will generously provide what we need. (AI)

*Today’s Verse:*

*Ask, and it will be given to you; seek and*

*you will find; knock, and the door will *

*be opened to you. *(Mt. 7:7)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Jesus tells us to persist in pursuing God.

people often give up after a few half-

hearted efforts and conclude that God

cannot be found. But knowing God takes

faith, focus, and follow through, and

Jesus assures that we will be rewarded.

Don’t give up in your efforts to seek God.

*Continue to ask Him for more knowledge,*

*patience, wisdom, and understanding. *

*He will give them to you**.*

* Pastor Sather *

subject: LIFE ISN'T ERROR-FREE
reflection:
What you say and what you don’t say are both important.
To use proper speech you must not only say the right words at the right time but also not say what you should’t. Examples of an untamed tongue include gossiping, putting others down, bragging, manipulating, false
teaching, exaggerating, complaining, flattering, and lying. Before you speak, ask, is what I want to say true? Is it necessary? Is it kind?
prayer: Gracious God, help us to tame our tongues and use our words wisely, speaking only what is true, necessary, and kind. May our speech build others up and bring glory to You. (AI)

*Today’s Verse:*

*We all stumble in many ways. Anyone *

*who is **never at fault in what they say *

*is perfect, able **to keep their whole body *

*in check. He will be **with you; He will *

*neither fail you nor abandon **you. *(Jm. 3:2)



*Today’s Reflection:*

What you say and what you don’t say

are both important. To use proper speech

you must not only say the right words

at the right time but also *not *say what

you shouldn’t. Examples of an untamed

tongue include gossiping, putting others

down, bragging, manipulating, false

teaching, exaggerating, complaining,

flattering, and lying. *Before you speak, *

*ask, is what I **want to say true? Is it *

*necessary? Is it kind?*

* Pastor Sather*

To use proper speech you must not only say the right words at the right time but also not say what you should’t. Examples of an untamed tongue include gossiping, putting others down, bragging, manipulating, false
teaching, exaggerating, complaining, flattering, and lying. Before you speak, ask, is what I want to say true? Is it necessary? Is it kind?

subject: TRUE LOVE
reflection: At being over eighty-two years old, I under stand with perfect hindsight that there are times we don’t make right choices. And yet the love of Jesus protects us from our per sonal folly. He pulls us close and reminds us that we are forgiven. Yes we are loved!
prayer: Merciful God, thank You for Your unfailing love that protects us even when we make poor choices, and for the assurance of forgiveness that draws us close to You. Help us to rest in Your grace and to share that love with others. (AI)

*Today’s Verse:*

*“I know the plans I have for you,” declares *

*the **Lord, “plans to prosper you and not to *

*harm **you, plans to give you hope and a *

*future. *(Jer. 29:11)



*Today’s Reflection:*

At being over eighty-two years old, I under-

stand with perfect hindsight that there are

times we don’t make right choices. And yet

the love of Jesus protects us from our per-

sonal folly. He pulls us close and reminds

us that we are forgiven. *Yes we are loved!*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: WHO DO YOU PRAISE
reflection: God alone is worthy to be worshiped. What is your attitude toward worship? Do you willingly and joyfully come into God's presence, or are you just going through the motions, reluctantly going to church? This psalm tells us to remember God's goodness and depend ability, And then worship with thanksgiving and praise!
prayer: Holy God, as we reflect on Your infinite worthiness, stir our hearts to worship You with genuine joy and gratitude, remembering Your unfailing goodness and faithfulness in our lives. May we approach Your presence with sincere thanksgiving and praise, not out of obligation but from a deep desire to honor You. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 1739ca3ee847873c
subject   : Subject: WHO DO YOU PRAISE (7-30-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>

date      : Wed, 29 Jul 2020 17:14:16 -0500

===================================================================
*Today's Verse:*
*Enter His gates with thanksgiving; go into*
*His courts with praise. Give thanks to Him*
*and bless His name. *(Ps. 100:4)

*Today's Reflection:*
God alone is worthy to be worshiped. What
is your attitude toward worship? Do you
willingly and joyfully come into God's presence,
or are you just going through the motions,
reluctantly going to church? This psalm tells
us to remember God's goodness and depend-
ability, *And then worship with thanksgiving*
*and praise!*
* Pastor Sather*
verse_text: Enter His gates with thanksgiving; go into His courts with praise. Give thanks to Him and bless His name.

Do you willingly and joyfully come into God's presence, or are you just going through the motions, reluctantly going to church? This psalm tells us to remember God's goodness and depend ability, And then worship with thanksgiving and praise!

subject: STRIVING FOR PATIENCE
reflection:
No one is ever going to be perfect here
on earth, so we must accept and love
other Christians in spite of their faults.
When we see faults in other believers,
we should be patient and gentle. Is there
someone whose actions or personality
really annoys you? Rather than dwelling
on that person’s weakness or looking
for faults, pray for him or her. Then do even more-spend time together and see if you can learn to like him or her.
prayer: Loving God, help us to accept and love our fellow believers despite their imperfections, just as You love us unconditionally. Grant us patience and gentleness when faced with others' faults, and guide us to see beyond weaknesses, fostering understanding and genuine connections with those who challenge us. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 173a1b2fc050472e
subject   : Subject: STRIVING FOR PATIENCE (7-31-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Thu, 30 Jul 2020 16:48:49 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Conduct yourselves with all humility,*

*gentleness and patience, accept each*

*other with love. *(Eph. 4:2)



*Today’s Reflection:*

No one is ever going to be perfect here

on earth*, *so we must accept and love

other Christians in spite of their faults.

When we see faults in other believers,

we should be patient and gentle. Is there

someone whose actions or personality

really annoys you? Rather than dwelling

on that person’s weakness or looking

for faults, pray for him or her. *Then*

*do even more—spend time together*

*and see if you can learn to like him*

*or her.*

* Pastor Sather*
verse_text: Conduct yourselves with all humility, gentleness and patience, accept each other with love.
original_verse_text: Conduct yourselves with all humility, gentleness and patience, accept each other with love.
original_reflection_text:
No one is ever going to be perfect here
on earth, so we must accept and love
other Christians in spite of their faults.
When we see faults in other believers,
we should be patient and gentle. Is there
someone whose actions or personality
really annoys you? Rather than dwelling
on that person’s weakness or looking
for faults, pray for him or her. Then do even more-spend time together and see if you can learn to like him or her.

subject: AN UNCHANGING LEADER
reflection:
Some of our leaders want us to believe they
have much to offer, but it is better if we keep
our eyes on Christ, our ultimate leader. Unlike
any human leaders he will never change. Christ
has been and will be the same forever. In our changing world we can trust our unchanging Lord.
prayer: Faithful God, help us to fix our gaze firmly on Christ, our unchanging and eternal leader, trusting in His constancy amidst the uncertainties of this world. May we find comfort and strength in His unwavering presence, now and always. (AI)
original_content:

subject   : Subject: AN UNCHANGING LEADER (8-1-20)

*Today’s Verse:*

*Jesus Christ is the same yesterday, today,*

*and forever. *(Heb. 13:8)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Some of our leaders want us to believe they

have much to offer, *but* it is better if we keep

our eyes on Christ, our ultimate leader. Unlike

any human leaders he will never change. Christ

has been and will be the same forever. *In our *

*changing world we can trust our unchanging*

*Lord.*

* Pastor Sather *
